page.title: 04Achahoish School
page.content: Achahoish School was in existence in 1837 and probably for a long time before that. It was a parochial school i.e. it was upheld by the landowner in the parish in terms of the Education Act 1696. The present school is about 300 metres from the church. The present building was built of stone in 1900 and incorporates a schoolhouse. The old schoolroom is now used as a room for music, P.E. etc. This building has an attached annexe built in 1966 which has a kitchen and dining room. Meals are cooked on the premises. All teaching in this one_teacher school is now done in a pre_fabricated building erected in 1976. It is well_equipped and has a T.V. video_recorder, and a computer. The school's roll in June 1985 was 9 ranging in age from 5 to 11 years.
